item.title: Problems with live mode
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Using Whonix VM? Which virtualizer?

Bigdaddy23:

I’ve made the disks into immutable and whatnot but after launching it there’s not option in the boot menu for the live mode.

immutable is a host virtualizer setting. The boot menu won’t change as a result of it.

Bigdaddy23:

In the storage information under “attached to” there’s nothing under it. Possibly a problem with re attaching it?

The boot menu does not “know” about that either.

The screenshot shown in https://www.whonix.org/wiki/VM_Live_Mode:

is default for many Whonix releases. That should look like that whether host virtualizer settings are set or not. Right after boot during the 5 seconds countdown. There is no special configuration needed to enable it.

This doesn’t happen in a new installed Whonix?

Did you uninstall the grub-live package unintentionally? See:

Whonix – 21 Aug 21

Whonix Debian Packages

Which Whonix ™ Debian packages are safe to remove? What is a meta package? What other packages do Whonix ™ meta packages install? Which packages should never be removed? Why is package X installed?

Make sure grub-live is installed / install.
